channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Self-doubt can be a secret weapon. You just have to know how to use it
item.description: When I was a leader in corporate America at a large regional bank, I held the assumption that once I was promoted, and received my new title and salar...

item.title: Want to Change How People Think About Your Product? Pick the Right Color
item.description: Medical device maker Insulet’s new collaboration with Pantone aims to shift sentiment. Here’s why it may work.

item.title: Exclusive: Touring Capital, founded by ex-M12 and SoftBank investors, closes $330 million first fund
item.description: Founded in 2023, Touring Capital has now closed its first fund at $330 million, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Everyone agrees stocks are suspiciously high. And everyone agrees they’re going higher anyway
item.description: The party is likely to continue despite the fact that the U.S. stock markets are dependent on the fate of just seven—or maybe even just one—company.

item.title: Whiskey missed its summer moment. Can it still win over Gen Z?
item.description: Whiskey has always carried weight. Think crystal tumblers, low-lit bars, Don Draper pouring a glass after a big win, or Sinatra crooning with a dram i...

item.title: Why Your Next Customers Won’t Find You on Google
item.description: The most profound shifts in technology don’t just change how people find things. They change who starts the search.

item.title: China’s top car exporter Chery gains in Hong Kong debut
item.description: Chery has remained China’s top exporting brand every year since 2003. Russia, the Middle East and South America are among its top overseas sales marke...

item.title: Apple Has a Blunt Message for European Users: The DMA Is Making Your iPhone Worse
item.description: The iPhone maker wants changes to the law that it says will be better for users.

item.title: Silicon Valley wants you to stop ‘rolling the dice’ about your future baby’s health
item.description: It had begun nearly two years prior, with a miscarriage, and then another. I was compiling a list of fertility clinics when he made an appearance on t...

item.title: How to write a successful Most Innovative Companies application
item.description: Fast Company ’s Most Innovative Companies is our flagship franchise and one of our most eagerly awaited editorial projects each year. To determine hon...

item.title: Apple admits some of its in-store chargers are scuffing the new iPhone 17 Pro, adding fuel to users’ durability concerns
item.description: Apple went for aluminum over titanium for this year's "Pro" iPhones, and this appears to be one of the trade-offs.

item.title: Bessent says New York can ‘drop dead’ if it elects Mamdani and ever needs a bailout
item.description: Bessent seemed determined to drive his warning home: "You can't enact policies like this and expect to be bailed out."

item.title: How the Expertise Economy Gives Your Business Access to Global Talent
item.description: Today’s job market is no longer about where you work — it’s about what you know and how fast you can apply that knowledge.

item.title: Starbucks has a new competitor, and you know them for their chicken sandwiches
item.description: Chick-fil-A says it’s testing out a stand-alone drinks-focused restaurant concept. Called Daybright, the new concept will open this fall outside Atlan...

item.title: Aldi Got Sued for Being a Copycat. What It Did Next Was Brilliant
item.description: After the owner of Oreos and Ritz crackers sued Aldi for copycat packaging, Aldi made a big change. It’s a lesson for every company.

item.title: Trump wanted Jimmy Kimmel cancelled. He gave him his highest ratings in 10 years
Now that 401(k) catch-ups for high earners have to be in a Roth, is it worth it?
